main event: Ground radar tracked a very bright, bluish-white object that moved, slowed, and stopped at times over Philadelphia, Pennsylvania on October 26, 1961.
interesting points: The object was tracked by both ground radar and visual observation, confirming the sighting.
The object would sometimes vanish from the radar screen.
The Air Force and Ground Observer Corps were both notified about the sighting.
The witness described the object as having characteristics of an unidentified aerial phenomenon.
Other similar sightings by citizens in the area had been reported over the years, going back to 1948.
witnesses: ground radar operators and multiple visual observers
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
